summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling previous resolutions on Iraq, particularly 1500 (2003), 1546 (2004), and 1557 (2004),
Reaffirming Iraq's independence, sovereignty, unity, and territorial integrity,
Recalling the establishment of UNAMI on 14 August 2003, and its extension on 12 August 2004,
 Reaffirming the UN's leading role in assisting Iraq's efforts in developing representative government institutions, promoting national dialogue and unity,
Stressing the cruciality of Iraqi national dialogue for stability and unity,
 Takes note of the Secretary-General's letter (S/2005/509) of 3 August 2005,
1. Decides to extend UNAMI's mandate for 12 months from the date of this resolution;
2. Expresses intention to review UNAMI's mandate in 12 months or sooner if requested by the Government of Iraq;
3. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
